archetype_name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
name: Indo-Chinese Chilli Paneer Stir-Fry with Basmati Rice
description: Crisp cornflour-coated paneer tossed with bell peppers, onions, and a tangy medium-heat chilli-garlic soy sauce. Serve over fluffy basmati rice for a fast family skillet dinner.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; drain.
Cut 400–500 g paneer into 2 cm cubes.
Slice 1 large onion and 2 bell peppers into strips.
Thinly slice 2 spring onion stalks (separate whites and greens).
In a small bowl, mix 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp vinegar, 1–2 tsp chilli paste, 1 tsp sriracha, 1 tsp sugar, and 3–4 tbsp water.
In another bowl, toss paneer cubes with 3 tbsp cornflour, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper.
cook_steps: Cook the rice: Add rinsed basmati rice to a pot with 2 1/4 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest 5 minutes, then fluff.
Heat 2 tbsp canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high.
Fry paneer in a single layer until golden and crisp on 2–3 sides, about 4–6 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Add 1 tbsp canola oil to the pan. Stir-fry onion, bell peppers, and spring onion whites for 2 minutes.
Add garlic and 1/4 tsp chili flakes (optional) and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir the sauce mixture, then pour into the pan. Simmer 1 minute to thicken slightly.
Return paneer to the pan; toss to coat. Drizzle 1 tsp sesame oil and adjust seasoning with soy sauce or sriracha to taste for medium heat.
Serve stir-fry over basmati rice. Garnish with spring onion greens and a pinch of sesame seeds if desired.
